node.contents: My name is sam and i'm a beginner in java.I have actually tried this "factorial" program on my own and i can't see whats going wrong with logic....I'm not getting the expected output,can anyone tell me why? Thanks in advance,grt day to all the users :)

node.contents: Factorial:

astNode.text: Factorial:

elements.contents: import java.util.*; class factorial { public static void main(String[] args) { int i; System.out.println("enter a number"); Scanner in=new Scanner(System.in); int n=in.nextInt(); int x=n; while(x!=0) { x=x*(n-1); n--; } System.out.println(x); } }

units.rawText: import java.util.*; class factorial { public static void main(String[] args) { int i; System.out.println("enter a number"); Scanner in=new Scanner(System.in); int n=in.nextInt(); int x=n; while(x!=0) { x=x*(n-1); n--; } System.out.println(x); } }

node.contents: When I enter (for example) 5, I expect to get the factoial of 5 (120). Instead, I get zero. This happens for all inputs.

astNode.text: When I enter (for example) 5, I expect to get the factoial of 5 (120). Instead, I get zero. This happens for all inputs.

node.contents: Have you tried your solution? Because it's wrong.

node.contents: <humour text="Hmm, we all know what multiplying by zero does but do we know what multiplying by the value `n-1` _twice_ does?" />. User2107258, I think you can probably fix the code by simply initialising `x` to `1` rather than `n-1`.

astNode.text: <humour text="Hmm, we all know what multiplying by zero does but do we know what multiplying by the value `n-1` _twice_ does?" />. User2107258, I think you can probably fix the code by simply initialising `x` to `1` rather than `n-1`.

node.contents: Try out this code:

astNode.text: Try out this code:

elements.contents: public static void main(String[] args) { int i; System.out.println("enter a number"); Scanner in=new Scanner(System.in); int n=in.nextInt(); int x=1; while(n!=0) { x*=(n); n--; } System.out.println(x); }

units.rawText: public static void main(String[] args) { int i; System.out.println("enter a number"); Scanner in=new Scanner(System.in); int n=in.nextInt(); int x=1; while(n!=0) { x*=(n); n--; } System.out.println(x); }

node.contents: Your while loop is multiplying your answer by 0 when n=1, and we all know what multiplying by 0 does.

elements.contents: int n = 5; // input value. int x = 1; // initial accumulator set to identity (n * 1 = n). while (n != 0) { // use all values from n down to 1 (inclusive). x = x * n; // multiply accumulator by that value. n--; // get next value. }
